title: This Serif Gothic style font?
content:
Been trying to give this font a name for a while...

A classic 70’s ITC style looking font. A bit like Serif Gothic with more of a twist.  
Its a record cover from Ai records and has subsequently been treated with a pattern-like effect hence the image quality of the jpeg.

Thanks in advance for looking.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font\_id.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214626/http:/typophile.com/files/font_id_0.jpg) | 33.36 KB |

 [‹ technical drawing font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214626/http:/typophile.com/node/32472 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Geert Mak "De eeuw van mijn vader" Dutch book cover serif face - Collis {Pieter} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214626/http:/typophile.com/node/32461 "Go to next forum topic")
author: belleisle

comments.content:
Looks like Busorama.

- Lex

EDIT: Almost - perhaps there were more alternates in the predigital face.

Don’t think Busorama. The cap ’E’ is to different.  
Up close I think I remember a slight serif.
Nick Curtis’ [Chi-Town](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214626/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/curtis/pages/c.htm) would be one version.
